channel.title: NYT > Business > Economy
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: After Court Defeat, Trump Warns of Economic Chaos From Loss of Tariffs
item.description: The president and his advisers have suggested they will fight a federal appeals court’s ruling that found many of the administration’s tariffs to be illegal.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm and Ana Swanson

item.title: fNothing Could Topple the ‘Queen of Heels.’ Then Trump Came Along.
item.description: The president’s steep tariffs and erratic moves have turned manufacturing abroad into a minefield, even for entrepreneurs who set up in countries viewed as safe alternatives to China.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Trump Family Profits Even With Tepid Launch of Crypto Tokens
item.description: World Liberty Financial’s cryptocurrency token fell short of investors’ hopes. But a previous deal paved the way for a payment to the Trump family of potentially hundreds of millions of dollars.
item.dc:creator: Eric Lipton

item.title: How Trump Could Gain Control of the Fed
item.description: President Trump’s attempt to fire Lisa Cook has laid bare the erosion of the Federal Reserve’s independence, which could lead to economic consequences for Americans, The New York Times’s chief economics correspondent explains.
item.dc:creator: Ben Casselman, Melanie Bencosme, June Kim, Gabriel Blanco and Jon Hazell

item.title: Trump’s Sweeping Tariffs Invalidated by Appeals Court
item.description: The decision is a big blow to President Trump’s trade policies, but the judges left the duties in place for now to allow time for a likely appeal to the Supreme Court.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm and Ana Swanson

item.title: The A.I. Spending Frenzy Is Propping Up the Real Economy, Too
item.description: The trillions of dollars that tech companies are pouring into new data centers are starting to show up in economic growth. For now, at least.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: Lisa Cook Defies Trump Bid to Fire Her as Fed Governor
item.description: Ms. Cook said that she would not resign from the Board of Governors, hours after President Trump announced he was firing her.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

item.title: Europe Is Spending Big on Defense. Will That Help Its Ailing Economy?
item.description: Leaders in Britain and the European Union are promoting the promise of economic benefits from increased military spending, but there is a trade-off.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Cohen

item.title: Trump Starts Investigation That Could Lead to Tariffs on Wind Turbines
item.description: The tariffs would hamper a clean energy industry that the president has often railed against.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Europe Gets a Written Trump Trade Deal, With a Caveat for Automakers
item.description: Under the newly fleshed-out details, Washington will maintain high tariffs on vehicles imported from the bloc until the E.U. takes steps to lower its levies on many American products.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm and Jeanna Smialek

item.title: Economic Data Has Taken a Dark Turn. That Doesn’t Mean a Crash Is Near.
item.description: Inflation is up and job creation down, but the U.S. economy could still pull through without too much pain.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: A New Way to Reduce Children’s Deaths: Cash
item.description: Simply giving money to poor families at certain times reduced deaths among young children by nearly half, a new study found.
item.dc:creator: Apoorva Mandavilli

item.title: Trump Warns of Economic Disaster if Court Strikes Down Tariffs
item.description: The president has crowed about the billions of dollars collected so far from tariffs. That money could be at risk if the White House loses the legal battle.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm

item.title: Trump Extends China Tariff Truce by Three Months
item.description: President Trump’s order continues a reprieve from the threat of escalating tariffs and export controls, which rocked the global economy earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: Car Companies Are Paying Tariffs So You Don’t Have To
item.description: But automakers can’t absorb the cost forever and will soon begin to raise new car prices, analysts say.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ewing

item.title: Trump Names EJ Antoni New BLS Commissioner
item.description: President Trump fired the Bureau of Labor Statistics chief earlier this month after a downbeat jobs report. The move has raised concerns about the credibility of economic data going forward.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm, Ben Casselman and Lydia DePillis

item.title: Small Businesses Brace for the Punishing Side Effects of Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Large firms with big bank balances, workers already in jobs and households near the top of the income ladder will have an easier time navigating the economic waves.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Cohen

item.title: What Lobsters and Chickens Reveal About Europe’s Trade Strategy
item.description: The European Union struck a trade deal that protected political priorities, like chicken and beef standards, while allowing headline-grabbing concessions. Consider lobsters.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek

item.title: Trump Is Removing Billy Long as the I.R.S. Head 2 Months After He Was Confirmed
item.description: Billy Long, a former Republican congressman, will no longer serve as the tax agency’s head. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will oversee the agency as acting commissioner.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Duehren, Alan Rappeport and Maggie Haberman

item.title: New Tariff on ‘Transshipped’ Goods Mystifies Importers
item.description: The Trump administration levied a hefty tariff on goods that are moved through other countries, but it has not yet fully explained its plans.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis
